# Pattern recognition data. 16 trace elements determined in 186 pieces 
# of flint collected at 11 different locations
#TITLE: 	Trace elements in archaeological flint from different locations
#DESCRIPTION:	186 samples, 11 different locations, 16 trace elements.
#VARIABLES:	Li, Na, etc:  Element symbols.; Location:  Code identifying the different sites; 
#UNITS:		Mass fraction times 10^6 (parts per million)
#REFERENCE_VALUES:	None
#APPLICATION_SECTOR:	Archaeometry
#ANALYTE:	Trace elements
#MATRIX_TYPE:	Flint
#RATIONALE:	Source determination, supervised learning
#DATA_TYPE:	Mulitvariate
#DATA_STRUCTURE:	Simple. Each row shows results for a different object.
#CONDITIONS:	Repeatability
#ORIGIN:	Experimental
#DATE_OF_ORIGIN:	1986
#AUTHOR:	Professor Michael Thompson
#AUTHOR_ADDRESS:	School of Biological and Chemical Sciences, Birkbeck College (University of London), Malet Street, London WC1E 7HX, 	 
#LITERATURE_REFERENCES:	M Thompson, P R Bush and J Ferguson (1986); THE ANALYSIS OF FLINT BY ICPAES AS A METHOD OF SOURCE DETERMINATION. In: G de G Sieveking (ed), ‘The  Scientific Study of Flint’, Proceedings of the International Flint Symposium 1983, Brighton, pp 243-247.
